info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 14 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... Very dry air will continue to settle into northeast Georgia through Wednesday. The combination of slightly warmer air temperatures and continued very dry dew point temperatures will yield minimum relative humidity values in the upper teens to lower 20s percent range on Wednesday afternoon. The very dry air will combine with rapidly drying brush and other surface fuels to increase fire danger despite diminishing winds. Please refer to your local burn permitting authorities on whether you can burn today. If you do burn, use extreme caution since fires can quickly get out of hand under these conditions.
